pageContext.description:
The portrait shows a courtly lady as a knee-length figure facing left against a black background. She wears a richly embroidered golden dress with a high collar as well as a golden hat with jewelled applications. A minature portrait of the artist is depicted in the pendant on her hat. She holds the hand of a c. 10 year old prince, whose royal origins are indicated by the red ermine coat. His dark blond hair has a page cut and he wears a decorated vermilion beret on his head. 

[Kulturstiftung Dessau Wörlitz; http://www.museum-digital.de/san/index.php?t=objekt&oges=16585; accessed 7 April 2015]

metadata.title: Electoress Margarete of Saxony and Prince Johann

pageContext.relatedWorks:
Rohrich painted numerous versions of this image in the style of Cranach. The version in Wörlitz was thought to be a Cranach portrait of the Electress Margarete of Saxony, née v. Anhalt (1494-1521) with Electoral prince Johann Friedrich (1503-1554).
Further examples are in the Hermitage (A Courtly Lady with Child), on the art market (Princess Sophie (1481-1503) with Prince Johann).
[Kulturstiftung Dessau Wörlitz; http://www.museum-digital.de/san/index.php?t=objekt&oges=16585; accessed 7 April 2015]
pageContext.repository: Kulturstiftung Dessau Wörlitz, Gotisches Haus (The Gothic House)

tests.text:
DESCRIPTION
 
Tools/Material: 
- fluid black medium, quill? 
 
Type/Ductus: 
- detailed underdrawing, both freehand and copied 
- fine lines; hatching-strokes 
 
 
Function: 
- binding for the final painted version; lines delineate the main contours and define essential details and facial features; representation of volume with hatching-strokes 
 
Deviations: 
- almost no alterations made during the painting process to clearly define forms; no changes 


INTERPRETATION
 
Attribution: 
- Franz Wolfgang Rohrich (loosely after Lucas Cranach the Elder)
 
Comments:
- probably transferred from a pre-existing design 

[Sandner, Smith-Contini, Heydenreich, cda 2015]

titles.title: Electoress Margarete of Saxony and Prince Johann
